Today, Dan and Jordan check in on a very frustrating day on the Alex Jones Show.  In this installment, Roger Stone announces that he has/had Covid and is suing everyone, Alex tries not to make fun of Brian Stelter, and Mike Lindell once again announces he has evidence that will put Trump back in office.

==Detailed Show Notes==

Topics covered<ref>[https://knowledgefight.com/research/2022/1/20/episode-639-january-17-2022 Episode #639: January 17, 2022]</ref>:

*Alex makes exaggerated claims about influencers being paid to promote vaccines. This has been done, like in [https://www.documentcloud.org/documents/21014896-cdphe-vaccine-campaign-comms-plan Colorado] and [https://www.cnn.com/2020/12/13/us/covid-influencer-instagram-tiktok-new-jersey-vaccine-trnd/index.html New Jersey], but it was in the form of a disclosed PSA.
*There was [https://www.nytimes.com/2021/05/26/business/pfizer-vaccine-disinformation-influeners.html a strange campaign] to pay influencers [https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/2021/08/11/facebook-russia-disformation-covid-vaccine/ to spread misinformation] about the Pfizer vaccine
*Alex tries and fails to cover a Brian Stelter video without making personal attacks
*Conspiracies about Washington state creating internment camps for the unvaccinated are rooted in [https://app.leg.wa.gov/WAC/default.aspx?cite=246-100-040&pdf=true a statute passed in 2003], which was recently [https://www.nbcrightnow.com/news/wa-board-of-health-did-not-enact-covid-internment-camps-or-vaccine-mandate-for-students/article_b986f0ec-740c-11ec-8bf4-dff54e0fb521.html amended to remove stigmatizing language] surrounding HIV/AIDS
*The [https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/global-covid-19/shielding-approach-humanitarian.html CDC document] Alex believes is a plan to put unvaccinated in camps [https://www.factcheck.org/2021/08/scicheck-cdc-document-discusses-strategy-to-protect-displaced-people-from-covid-19/ has nothing to do with that at all]
*Alex believes that a [https://www.naturalnews.com/2021-08-19-fema-documents-isolation-quarantine-round-up-dissenters.html poorly written article on Natural News] reflects FEMA documents about their plans to create internment camps for unvaccinated people in rural areas. This article is actually just a reposting of another [https://steverotter.com/concentration-camps-for-the-unvaccinated/ blog post from a guy named Steve Rotter], who is misrepresenting [https://www.ok.gov/homeland/courses/documents/1505/MGT%20433-PER%20308%20Registration%20Flyer%20-%20Goldsby,%20OK_03-23-16.pdf training] provided by the Rural Domestic Preparedness Consortium Organization that long predates Covid
*Alex is close enough to right about [https://www.rasmussenreports.com/public_content/politics/partner_surveys/jan_2022/crosstabs_heartland_covid_january_5_2022 recent Rasmussen polling]
*Alex misreports on [https://www.sltrib.com/opinion/editorial/2022/01/15/utah-leaders-have/ an op-ed] from a Utah paper
*All of the documents posted on [https://app.leg.wa.gov/WAC/default.aspx the Washington legislature's website] say "certified on October 25, 2019" on them
*Roger Stone had Covid, and is planning to sue everyone
*Roger's story about Richard Nixon and Coretta Scott King is [https://ibw21.org/commentary/richard-nixons-secret-visit-with-coretta-scott-king/ possibly inaccurate]
*In 2008, [https://www.newyorker.com/magazine/2008/06/02/the-dirty-trickster Roger took credit for the Brooks Brothers riot]
*Roger seems to have some racist takes about various Florida congressional hopefuls
*Mike Lindell is incorrect about [https://www.deseret.com/utah/2020/11/20/21587694/vote-by-cellphone-pilot-legislature-blockchain-voatz-election-security-cryptocurrency-smartphone alternative voting options] in Utah
*Alex thinks [https://www.vcstar.com/story/opinion/columnists/2022/01/13/column-california-should-abolish-parenthood-name-equity/6513756001/ a satirical article about abolishing parenthood] is a real article making a sincere argument
